nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Data Asset~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Pull in data from remote data sources using connections, or pull in data from a file.~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~User Input~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Easily create synthetic data—either from scratch or by altering existing data.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Sim Gen~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Generate simulated data automatically or with user-specified statistical distributions.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Select~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Select or discard a subset of records from the data stream based on a specific condition.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Sample~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Select a subset of records for analysis, or specify a proportion of records to discard.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Sort~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Sort records into ascending or descending order based on the values of one or more fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Balance~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Correct imbalances in datasets so they conform to specified test criteria.~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Distinct~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Find or remove duplicate records in your data, or create a single, composite record from a group of duplicate records.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Aggregate~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Replace a sequence of input records with summary, aggregated output records.~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Merge~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Take multiple input records and create a single output record containing all or some of the input fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Append~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Combine datasets with similar structures but different data.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Space-Time-Boxes~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~An STB is an alphanumeric string that represents a regularly shaped region of space and time.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Streaming TS~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build and score time series models in one step.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~SMOTE~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~To perform over-sampling using SMOTE - Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~RFM Aggregate~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Take historical transaction data, strip away unused data, and combine all remaining transaction data into one row.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Auto Data Prep~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Prepare your data for model building quickly and easily, without needing prior knowledge of the statistical concepts involved.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Type~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Specify field metadata and properties that are invaluable to modeling.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Filter~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Rename or exclude fields at any point in a flow.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Derive~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Modify data values or create new fields from one or more existing fields.~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Filler~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Replace field values and change storage. Often used with a Type node to replace missing values.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Reclassify~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Transform one set of categorical values to another. Useful for collapsing categories or regrouping data for analysis.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Binning~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Automatically create new nominal fields based on the values of one or more existing continuous fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~RFM Analysis~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Examine recent customer purchases (recency), how often they purchased (frequency), and how much they spent (monetary).~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Ensemble~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Combines two or more model nuggets to obtain more accurate predictions than can be gained from any of the individual models.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Partition~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Generate a partition field that splits data into separate subsets or samples for the training, testing, and validation stages of model building.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~SetToFlag~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Derive flag fields based on the categorical values defined for one or more nominal fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Restructure~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Generate multiple fields based on the values of a nominal or flag field.~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Transpose~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Swap the data in rows and columns so that fields become records and records become fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Field Reorder~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Define the natural order for displaying fields downstream.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~History~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Create new fields containing data from fields in previous records (most often used for sequential data, such as time series data).~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Time Intervals~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Specify intervals and derive a new time field for estimating or forecasting.~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Anonymize~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Disguise field names, field values, or both when working with data that's to be included in a model downstream of the node.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Reproject~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Change the coordinate system for fields that can't be reprojected automatically.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Charts~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Launch the chart builder and create chart definitions to save with your flow.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Plot~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Shows the relationship between numeric fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Multiplot~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~A special type of plot that displays multiple Y fields over a single X field.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Time plot~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~View one or more time series plotted over time.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Distribution~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Shows the occurrence of symbolic (non-numeric) values, such as mortgage type or gender, in a dataset.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Histogram~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Shows the occurrence of values for numeric fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Collection~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Shows the distribution of values for one numeric field relative to the values of another.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Web~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Shows the strength of relationships between values of two or more symbolic fields.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Evaluation~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Evaluate and compare predictive models to choose the best model for your application.~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Auto Classifier~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Estimates and compares models to try out a variety of approaches for nominal and binary data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Auto Numeric~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Estimates and compares models to try out a variety of approaches for a continuous numeric range.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Auto Cluster~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Estimates and compares clustering models that identify groups of records with similar characteristics.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Bayes Net~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build a probability model to establish the likelihood of occurrences by using seemingly unlinked attributes.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~C5.0~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build either a decision tree or a ruleset by splitting the sample based on the field that provides the maximum information gain.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~C&R Tree~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Tree-based classification and prediction method that splits training records into segments with similar output field values.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~CHAID~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build decision trees by using chi-square statistics to identify optimal splits.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Quest~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build decision trees by using a binary classification method.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Tree-AS~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build decision trees using either a CHAID or Exhaustive CHAID model.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Random Trees~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build an ensemble model that consists of multiple decision trees.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Random Forest~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Implement a bagging algorithm with a tree model as the base model.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Decision List~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Identify subgroups or segments that show a higher or lower likelihood of a binary (yes or no) outcome relative to the overall sample.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Time Series~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Estimate and build exponential smoothing, ARIMA, or multivariate ARIMA models and produce forecasts.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~TCM~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Create a temporal causal model to discover key causal relationships in time series data.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~GenLin~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build an equation that relates the input field values to the output field values.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~GLMM~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Creates a generalized linear mixed model that extends the linear model.~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~GLE~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Identify the dependent variable that's linearly related to the factors and covariates via a specified link function.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Linear~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Classify records based on the values of numeric input fields.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Linear-AS~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Classify records based on the values of numeric input fields.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Regression~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Classify records based on the values of numeric input fields.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~LSVM~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Use a linear support vector machine to classify data.~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Logistic~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Classify records based on the values of categorical input fields.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Neural Net~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Approximate a wide range of predictive models with minimal demands on model structure and assumption.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~KNN~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Find patterns of data without requiring an exact match to any stored patterns, or cases.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Cox~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build a predictive model for time-to-even data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~PCA/Factor~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Provides powerful data-reduction techniques to reduce the complexity of your data.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~SVM~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Use a support vector machine to classify data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Feature Selection~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Identify fields that are most important for a given analysis.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Discriminant~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Build a predictive model for group membership.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~SLRM~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Predict which offers are most appropriate for customers and the probability of the offers being accepted.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~STP~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Has many potential applications such as energy management for buildings, or public transport planning.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Association Rules~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Automatically find associations that you could find manually using visualization techniques.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Apriori~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Discover association rules in your data.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Carma~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Use an association rules discovery algorithm to discover association rules in your data.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Sequence~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Discover patterns in sequential or time-oriented data.~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Kohonen~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Cluster your dataset into distinct groups when you don't know what those groups are at the beginning.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Anomaly~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Identify outliers, or unusual cases, in your data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~K-Means~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Use a cluster method to cluster your dataset into distinct groups when you don't know what those groups are at the beginning.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~TwoStep~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Cluster your dataset into distinct groups when you don't know what those groups are at first.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~TwoStep-AS~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Use this exploratory tool  to reveal natural groupings (clusters) within your dataset.~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Isotonic-AS~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Isotonic Regression belongs to the family of regression algorithms. Implemented in Spark.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~K-Means-AS~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Cluster data points into a predefined number of clusters.~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~KDE Modeling~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Walks the line between unsupervised learning, feature engineering, and data modeling.~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Gaussian Mixture~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~CExposes the core features and commonly used parameters of the Gaussian Mixture Python library.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~XGBoost-AS~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: xgboostas.desc

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~XGBoost Tree~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Uses an advanced implementation of a gradient boosting algorithm with a tree model as the base model.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~XGBoost Linear~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Uses an advanced implementation of a gradient boosting algorithm with a linear model as the base model.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~One-Class SVM~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Detects the soft boundary of a given set of samples, to then classify new points as belonging to that set or not.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~MultiLayerPerceptron-AS~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~A classifier based on the feedforward artificial neural network. Consists of multiple layers.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~HDBSCAN~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Uses unsupervised learning to find clusters, or dense regions, of a data set.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Language Identifier~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Identify the natural language of a text field within your source data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Text Link Analysis~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Identify relationships between the concepts in the text data based on known patterns.~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Text Mining~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Extract key concepts from text and create categories with these concepts and other data.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Table~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Create a table that lists the values in your data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Matrix~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Create a table that shows relationships between fields.~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Analysis~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Evaluate the ability of a model to generate accurate predictions.~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Data Audit~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Get a comprehensive first look at your data, presented in an easy-to-read matrix.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Transform~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Perform a rapid visual assessment of the best transformation to use.~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Statistics~~~~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Get basic summary information about numeric fields.~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Means~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Compare the means between independent groups or between pairs of related fields to test whether a significant difference exists.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Report~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Create formatted reports containing fixed text, data, or other expressions derived from your data.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Set Globals~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Scans your data and computes summary values that can be used in CLEM expressions.~~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Sim Fit~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Fits a set of candidate statistical distributions to each field in your data.~~~~~~~~~eo]

nodetypes.label: [Esperanto~Data Asset Export~~~eo]
nodetypes.description: [Esperanto~Write to remote data sources using connections.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~eo]
